metadata.titleEn: Geochemical data of Early Cretaceous (~ 110mA) intermediate acid magmatic rocks in Xinji Township, bange County, Qinghai Tibet Plateau
metadata.description:
This data set contains zircon U-Pb dating, zircon Hf isotope, whole-rock principal, and trace element data of diorite granite and andesite dacite in Xinjiang area, south of bango, Qinghai Tibet Plateau. The data results are from the Zhai Qingguo research team, Institute of Geology, Chinese Academy of Geological Sciences. The data are of good quality and can be used to study the ocean closure process of Bangong Lake Nujiang suture in the central Qinghai Tibet Plateau, the subsequent collision process of Lhasa Qiangtang block, magmatism, and the Cretaceous crustal regeneration and reconstruction of Lhasa block in the central and Northern Qinghai Tibet Plateau. At the same time, this data also provides zircon CL images and reflection photos of all samples, zircon location for reference and comparison, and also provides a basis for the chronology of magmatic rocks and zircon genesis in the study area at the same time.
Zircon U-Pb age instrument: obtained from laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS), zircon Hf isotope instrument: Neptune multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (MC – ICP – MS), connected by a goals-193 laser ablation system. The main and trace elements of the whole rock are measured by the National Experimental Center (Academy of Geosciences), Major elements: (XRF; Axios – pw4400), trace elements: ICP-MS; PerkinElmer NexION 300D。
metadata.instructions: The geochemical data file name is LITHOS data, which is an. Xlsx file. The file contains three sheets. U-Pb age data is the result of zircon U-Pb data, Hf isotope is the Hf isotope of zircon, and whole rocks is the result of major and trace elements of the whole rock. Zircon CL images and reflection and transmission images include all 6 samples. All original images are spliced into the whole sample and named as sampling year + place + sample number. For example, the Tibetan sample in 2016 is 16t * * *. The spliced images are in TIF format. The first row is the reflection image, the second row is the CL image, and the third shot is the transmission image.

authorList.unitEn: Institute of Geology, Chinese Academy of Geological Sciences

literatureList.titleEn: Simultaneous growth and reworking of the Lhasa basement: A case study from Early Cretaceous magmatism in the north-central Tibet
literatureList.referenceEn: Wang, W., Zhai, Q.G., Hu, P.Y., Chung, S.L., Tang, Y., Wang, H.T., Zhu, Z.C., Wu, H., & Huang, Z.Q. (2020). Simultaneous growth and reworking of the Lhasa basement: A case study from Early Cretaceous magmatism in the north-central Tibet. Lithos, 380-381, 105863.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to determine the U-Pb age of zircons in magmatic rocks?
Example.Answer: One data collection method used to determine the U-Pb age of zircons in magmatic rocks is laser-ablation-inductively coupled plasma-mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS).

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics and specifications of data collection methods used for determining zircon U-Pb ages and Hf isotopes in geological studies of magmatic rocks?
Feature Specification.Answer: laser-ablation-inductively coupled plasma-mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS), Neptune Multi-Collector Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry (MC–ICP–MS), Geolas-193 laser ablation system

Quantification.Question: What is the number of rock samples analyzed for zircon U-Pb dating using LA-ICP-MS in a dataset related to early Cretaceous magmatic rocks in the Bangong Co-Nujiang suture zone?
Quantification.Answer: The number of samples for zircon U-Pb dating is not explicitly mentioned.

Interpretation.Question: What can be inferred about the geological processes and tectonic history of the central Tibetan Plateau from the patterns observed in zircon U-Pb dating and Hf isotopic compositions?
Interpretation.Answer: The zircon U-Pb dating and Hf isotopic compositions can provide insights into the timing and sequence of magmatic events related to the closure of the Bangong-Nujiang Ocean and subsequent collision processes between the Lhasa and Qiangtang terranes. These data can help interpret the crustal growth and reworking during the Cretaceous period in the northern Lhasa terrane.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary objective of collecting geochemical data on intermediate-acidic magmatic rocks from the early Cretaceous period in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau region?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objective is to study the closure process of the Bangong Lake-Nujiang Tethys Ocean and the subsequent collision processes of the Lhasa-Qiangtang blocks, as well as to understand the magmatism and crustal growth and reworking during the Cretaceous period in the central and northern Lhasa block.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures are used to ensure data quality and accuracy when collecting geochemical data from zircon U-Pb dating and zircon Hf isotopes in magmatic rocks?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The geochemical data from zircon U-Pb dating is obtained using laser-ablation-inductively coupled plasma-mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS), while zircon Hf isotopes are measured using Neptune Multi-Collector Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry (MC–ICP–MS), connected by a Geolas-193 laser ablation system. These instruments are employed to ensure high precision and accuracy in the data collection process.

Enablement.Question: What technological advancements have enabled the precise collection of zircon U-Pb dating and Hf isotopic data in geochemical studies of magmatic rocks?
Enablement.Answer: The collection of zircon U-Pb dating and Hf isotopic data in geochemical studies is enabled by technologies such as laser-ablation-inductively coupled plasma-mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) for zircon U-Pb ages, and Neptune Multi-Collector Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry (MC–ICP–MS) connected by a Geolas-193 laser ablation system for zircon Hf isotopes.
